look at this picture of this adorable kitten and notice the look of fear on his face. In 54 years of life I don't remember ever seeing an animal look afraid of anything. I've seen what appears to be joy and anger, but never fear. But this kitten looks afraid to me. Or is it just stress? Is there a difference between the two emotions for animals? Any personal stories of observations you have made in your experiences with animals, either first hand or as observations?
 
 http://news.yahoo.com/nphotos/Most-Emailed-Photos-Amman/ss/1756/im:/080123/photos_od/2008_01_23t113101_450x349_us_kitten/;_ylt=AlLA8ksfATYm29oQA95tyUXmWMcF

AAA POOT PITTY!
 
 Its the wide eyes. One of my cats has that look all the time, too. A frightened cat hisses, spits, runs, hides - in that general order.
That looks more like bewilderment than fear to me. The only views I've seen of frightened cats have all been from behind.

I looked at that picture and my heart bled for that cute little kitten. If I could have, I would have adopted him on the spot. To me, he looks very stressed at the very least, if not afraid of what ever he was looking at. 
 
 photo:
 http://d.yimg.com/us.yimg.com/p/nm/20080123/2008_01_23t113101_450x349_us_kitten.jpg?x=400&y=310&sig=gA_vS_nNhd4.f0TRFW2eSg--
He's just been told he doesn't have a soul, and can't go to heaven. ;)
Now that the thread has been necro'd, all the photos have gone.
